question_text:
Subtract.$\frac{1}{2}$-$\frac{2}{6}$=_
Use the model to help you.
backend_description: This image shows the subtraction problem 1/2 - 2/6 using colored fraction models. A single pink rectangle labeled 1/2 is shown above, and two teal rectangles labeled 1/6 each are below it. A minus sign and a horizontal line indicate that the subtraction will be performed between these two amounts.
solution:
Rename the fractions using a common denominator.
$\frac{1}{2}$ is the same size as $\frac{3}{6}$.
So, $\frac{1}{2}$-$\frac{2}{6}$ is the same as $\frac{3}{6}$-$\frac{2}{6}$.

This image shows the process of converting 1/2 into an equivalent fraction with a denominator of 6. The pink 1/2 rectangle is shown transforming into three teal 1/6 blocks, with a downward arrow between them. This demonstrates that 1/2 = 3/6, making it easier to subtract.

The final image shows the subtraction 3/6 - 2/6 using matching fraction models. Three teal 1/6 rectangles are on top, and two 1/6 rectangles are shown beneath the subtraction sign. After removing two of the three, only one 1/6 block remains, showing that the result is 1/6.
